message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM 

The paper presents a novel approach to automatically segment magnetic resonance (MR) images of the human brain into anatomical regions using a deep artificial neural network. This methodology involves capturing information at different scales around the voxel of interest, which is a common approach in computer vision (cs.CV). The use of deep neural networks also suggests that the paper could belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) or artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves the use of distances to regional centroids, which is a common technique in neural networks for clustering (cs.NE). Finally, the paper involves the segmentation of medical images, which could also place it in the medical imaging (cs.MM) sub-category.
